author: Michael Larabel
description: U-Boot 2025.07 is out today as the newest version of this popular open-source boot loader that is widely-used among embedded devices across different CPU architectures...
title: U-Boot 2025.07 Brings New Code For Apple M1/M2 & Raspberry Pi, exFAT Support

author: Michael Larabel
description: The Thunderbird mail client developers today formally announced Thunderbird 140 as the newest Extended Support Release (ESR) for this cross-platform alternative to Microsoft Outlook...
title: Thunderbird 140 Mail Client Debuts As Newest ESR Release

author: Michael Larabel
description: One topic we haven't heard AMD talk too much about publicly this year has been their openSIL effort that was announced back in 2023 as their eventual replacement to AGESA and being an open-source CPU silicon initialization effort. They still appear to be working toward making openSIL production-ready for next-generation Zen 6 platforms but some of their proof-of-concept milestones have been running behind schedule. Meanwhile their EPYC 9005 "Turin" proof-of-concept code was recently published...
title: AMD openSIL PoC Still Being Worked On For Phoenix SoCs, Turin Code Published

author: Michael Larabel
description: Being worked on for a number of months now has been the Lenovo Gaming Series WMI Drivers for Linux to expose additional power/performance settings for Lenovo gaming series hardware like the Lenovo Legion Go S gaming handheld with Steam OS. With the upcoming Linux 6.17 kernel, the Lenovo WMI Gaming Series Drivers are expected to be finally upstreamed...
title: Lenovo WMI Gaming Series Drivers Expected To Debut In Linux 6.17

author: Michael Larabel
description: The GNOME 49 Alpha "49.alpha" release was just announced as the first formal test release in the road to the GNOME 49 desktop release due out in September...
title: GNOME 49 Alpha Released With X11 Support Disabled By Default, Many New Features

author: Michael Larabel
description: Merged today for the LLVM/Clang compiler is -mcpu=gb10 support for catering to NVIDIA's forthcoming Grace Blackwell GB10 Superchip...
title: LLVM Clang Merges -mcpu=gb10 Support For NVIDIA GB10 Superchip

author: Michael Larabel
description: While coming a few weeks too late for making it into the LibreOffice 25.8 open-source office suite release, merged today to LibreOffice Git for next year's LibreOffice 26.2 is adding initial support for importing Markdown files into the LibreOffice Writer word processor...
title: LibreOffice Begins Landing Markdown File Import Support

author: Michael Larabel
description: With the upcoming Linux 6.17 kernel cycle Intel is further building out their Platform Monitoring Technology (PMT) capabilities with the introduction of a new discovery driver...
title: Intel VSEC/PMT Discovery Driver Expected For Linux 6.17 To Enhance Telemetry

author: Michael Larabel
description: The AMDKFD "Kernel Fusion Driver" used as the Linux kernel GPU compute driver and necessary part of their ROCm compute stack it turns out can build and run on the Chinese-developed LoongArch systems rather easily...
title: AMDKFD Kernel Compute Driver Used By ROCm Can Work On LoongArch Hardware

author: Michael Larabel
description: As a good sign of the progress being made on the Xe3 integrated graphics Linux support and of the Core Ultra Panther Lake launch approaching, the necessary graphics firmware binaries have now been upstreamed to the linux-firmware.git repository...
title: Intel Panther Lake Xe3 Integrated Graphics Firmware Upstreamed

author: Michael Larabel
description: TornadoVM version 1.1.1 is now available for this OpenJDK and GraalVM plug-in that supports Java offloading to GPUs, FPGAs, and other heterogeneous hardware. The past few years TornadoVM has been making a lot of progress to automatically run Java programs across GPUs and other devices supporting OpenCL, NVIDIA PTX, and Khronos SPIR-V/Vulkan...
title: TornadoVM 1.1.1 Released For Java Programming Of Heterogeneous Hardware
